title: Ginny D
tagline: How to move your business online? Launch a beautifully made bespoke ecommerce website to sell your products, services and... gift cards!
features: Automated order and gift voucher email notifications
content1:
Ginny is a bespoke jewellery maker who sells jewellery on the markets across the country. However, due to the COVID-19 restrictions, the markets were temporarily closed, therefore she decided to move her business online.

Ginny decided to go for a bespoke ecommerce website instead of Shopify, because Edward Robertson is a trusted tech partner with a team of talented designers who are happy to provide continous support with the website.
content2:
My approach was to design a mobile-friendly website that showcases Ginny's products and services. I took extra care to make sure that the site is super easy to use. How? I decided to display all product categories in the main navigation, so that visitors can easily find what they need (no need for search facility!). There is also a handy shortcut to the contact page, while all other information are easily availble from the right handside dropdown menu. Customers can also easily preview the contents of their basket.

Ginny wanted maximise the sales, therefore I opted for a cross-selling features. With some research, I figured out that customers are likely to continue shopping if they are presented with similar products. Now, the site not only shows feedback that product has been added to the basket, but also suggests similar products. How clever!

The site is packed with features, such as reactive basket, featured and matching products, gift voucher facility and discount codes.
title3: Optimised for SEO and Google's PageSpeed
content3: The site utilises clever features of HTML5 to load either desktop or mobile version of the image. Also, each image has been optimised. The stylsheet has been split into critical and non-critical CSS, whereas all JavaScript code has been minified to ensure fast loading speeds.
